title: Wadi es-Saba Monuments
description: Two inscribed reliefs of a Neo-Babylonian king (probably Nebuchadnezzar II) are carved on a rock face in the Wadi es-Saba (“Valley of the Lion”), southwest of Akroum, Lebanon.

properties.description: The estimated, representative location was provided by Rocio Da Riva, who visited the reliefs in 2007, via a Google satellite image.
properties.title: Imagery Location of the Wadi es-Saba Monuments
